verses.verse: (1 David driven forth of his country,2 Desireth most ardently to come again to the tabernacle of the Lord and the assembly of the Saints to praise God,4 pronouncing them blessed that may so do.6 Then he praiseth the courage of the people, that pass through the wilderness to assemble themselves in Zion.10 Finally, with praise of this matter and confidence of God’s goodness, he endeth the Psalm. ) O Lord of hosts, how amiable are thy Tabernacles?

My soul longeth, yea, and fainted for the (For none but the Priests could enter into the Sanctuary, and the rest of the people into the courts.) courts of the Lord: for my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

Yea, the sparrow hath found her an house, and the swallow a nest for her, where she may lay her young: even by thine (So that the poor birds have more liberty than I.) altars, O Lord of hosts, my king and my God.
Blessed are they that dwell in thine house, they will ever praise thee. Selah.
Blessed is the man whose (Who trusteth nothing in himself, but in thee only, and learneth of thee to rule his life.) strength is in thee, and in whose heart are thy ways.

They going through the valley of (That is of mulberry trees, which was a barren place: so that they which passed through, must dig pits for water: signifying, that no lets can hinder them that are fully bent to come to Christ’s Church, neither yet that God will ever fail them.) Baca, make wells therein: the rain also covereth the pools.
They go from (They are never weary but increase in strength and courage till they come to God’s house.) strength to strength, till every one appear before God in Zion.
O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer, hearken, O God of Jacob. Selah.
Behold, O God, our shield, and look upon the face of thine (That is, for Christ’s sake, whose figure I represent.) Anointed.

For (He would wish to live but one day rather in God’s Church, than a thousand among the worldlings.) a day in thy courts is better than a thousand other where: I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tabernacles of wickedness.

For the Lord God is the sun and shield unto us: the Lord will give grace and glory, and no (But will from time to time increase his blessings toward his more and more.) good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
